turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello.  Would you like to donate a portion of your reward to a charity called Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I think I would be willing to donate a portion.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Excellent!  Would you like to know more about the charity first?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, that was going to be my next question.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children promotes children's rights, and helps children from developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What types of children's rights?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Your donation would help ensure children's rights to health, education, and safety.  Many of these children live in developing or war-torn areas where these basic necessities are hard to come by.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What type of people or who manages this fund?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children has excellent credentials and is managed by a board of commercial CEOs and business leaders without any government or religious affiliation.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Does Save the Children help children in the United States?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes!  Since 1932, Save the Children has been on the ground providing support to the most isolated and underserved children in rural America.  Many of these children don't have the same opportunities as others and live in very difficult conditions.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is awesome. I work hard to help children as well.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's great!  It is a worthwhile cause and every penny has a significant impact on these children's lives.  Even a small donation can have a large impact in impoverished areas.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am curious why you chose the words "rural America"?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Of course.  I chose those words because across the United States, one in five children grows up in poverty and, of the counties with the highest poverty rates, 90% are rural. Because of circumstances beyond their control, millions of kids never reach their full potential.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: mmmm that is interesting, I did not know that statistic.  I work with children more in an "urban" setting that are incredibly in bad circumstances.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I agree that children in both settings need help and commend you for your efforts.  Admittedly, Save the Children may also have urban programs, but I drew the above information from their website, which you can find at  URL   Are you still interested in donating a portion of your reward?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am interested. I am curious if I can state if money goes to children in this country though?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, you should be able to specify that.  The researchers will use this chat to determine how much of your reward to donate and will see that you have earmarked it for Save the Children's US efforts.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That is awesome then I will donate $1.  I feel very strongly about "our own children" !!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Excellent!  Thank you very much for your generous donation!
